did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Files, correspondence, teaching materials, letters of recommendation, memoirs, and other papers.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Papers of Harold Shadick include files relating to his career as Professor of Chinese Literature, 1946-1971, on administration of graduate study, miscellaneous teaching materials, and letters of recommendation; files as Director of the China Program, 1950-1966, on development of faculty positions, faculty, graduate students, development of the Wason Collection, relations of the Program within and outside the University.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Harold Shadick was Professor of Chinese Literature at Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Papers of Harold Shadick include files relating to his career as Professor of Chinese Literature, 1946-1971, on administration of graduate study, miscellaneous teaching materials, and letters of recommendation; files as Director of the China Program, 1950-1966, on development of faculty positions, faculty, graduate students, development of the Wason Collection, relations of the Program within and outside the University.
Includes correspondence, notes, daybooks, class lists, memoirs, and teaching materials. Also, CHINOPERL correspondence and records (Conference on Chinese Oral and Performing Literature).

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: CHINOPERL (Conference on Chinese Oral and Performing Literature).

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Harold Shadick papers, #14-13-2613. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

Series III. University and College Committees, etc.

Series IV. Director: Inter-university Fellowships for Field Training in Chinese, 1956-1962, financed by the Ford Foundation
Box 4

Series IV. Director: Inter-university Fellowships for Field Training in Chinese, 1956-1962, financed by the Ford Foundation
Box 4-5

Series V. Director: Research Project "Linguistic Studies in Modern Chinese" commissioned by the U.S. Office of Education, 1960-1968
Box 5-6

Series VI. Participation in the Development of Chinese Studies
Box 6

did.unittitle: Series I. Professor of Chinese Literature, 1946-1971
A. Degrees taken in Chinese Literature
B. Administration of graduate study and miscellaneous teaching material
Chinese 313 Philosophy and History tests - exam Jan. 1966
Seminar - Far Eastern Studies [FES] 611-612, 1961-62: Modern China
Notes and materials relating to lectures in FES 611
Tsing Hua Fellowship Fund Grant - $500 #4210 - Dr. Y. C. Mei, President - National Tsing Hua Univ.
Notes on books for Classical Grammar
Dick Bodman grad. exam under Prof. Mei
Series II. Director of the China Program (present East Asia Program)
A. Development of faculty positions in various disciplines
Appointment in Economics - Richard H. Moorsteen
Documents on P. Schran and Hou Chi-Ming
Spring - seminar in Modern China, F.E.S. 612, 1961-62
E. Development of the Wason Collection
F. Relations of the China Program within the University
Communications with Chairman/Department of Asian Studies
Acting Chairman of F.E.S - Chinese Studies, 1949-50
Acting chair F.E.S. - HRAF (Human Relation Area Files)
Communication with Dean of Arts and Sciences
Possible structural changes in Department of Asian Studies
G. Relations of the China Program outside the University
NDEA (National Defense Education Act) Center reports, 1964-65, 1969
Series III. University and College Committees, etc.
B. College Committee on the Humanities, 1964-1965
C. Advisor to the Chinese Student Club, 1957-1964
Series IV. Director: Inter-university Fellowships for Field Training in Chinese, 1956-1962, financed by the Ford Foundation
Annual Report for Ford Foundation - Inter-University Fellowship Program
Form letters sent to cooperating centers
Current discussion of training and stipend problems
Mrs. Elizabeth L. Mirsky - field director of studies in Taiwan, 1960-61
Series V. Director: Research Project "Linguistic Studies in Modern Chinese" commissioned by the U.S. Office of Education, 1960-1968
Fellowship Program and Centre in Taipei
Inquiries regarding Inter-University Fellowship Program, also requests for application forms
Correspondence with and about the Field
Form letters sent to members of the Selection Committee
Information on travel and living in Taiwan
Winding up the Cornell Center in Taiwan and planning a seccessor - Stanford? Yale?
Linguistics Studies SAE 8984 #743 - supporting documents, bills, vouchers, etc.
NDEA - Linguistics Studies account #7431 (#6283 eff. July 1, 1964)
Series VI. Participation in the Development of Chinese Studies
Anthology material - plan for an anthology of translations from Chinese, 1956
MLA Committee Conference on Teaching of Chinese
Committee on Studies of Chinese Civilization,1963-68
Conference - Genres of Chinese Literature, Bermuda, 1967
New York State Education Department (and Ward Morehouse)
Prof. Bertha Davis - The Ways of Man, 1968-71
